ca.mcgill.ecse211.controller

Class RobotController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.controller.RobotController

  • public class RobotController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves to control the robot's motors It allows the robot to perform basic operations such as move forward, change speed, navigate to a specific point, to stop etc. Since it controls the mobility of the robot, it is essentially used in all navigation classes namely in usLocalizer, lightLocalizer, navigation and ringSearcher
    Author:
    Jeffrey Leung

      • convertDistance

        public static int convertDistance(double radius,
                                  double distance)
        This method allows the conversion of a distance to the total rotation of each wheel need to cover that distance.
        Parameters:
        radius - radius of wheel
        distance - desired distance to move the robot
        Returns:
        angle the robot needs to rotate its wheels in order to travel forward by the distance provided

      • convertAngle

        public static int convertAngle(double radius,
                               double width,
                               double angle)
        This method allows the conversion of a angle to the total rotation of each wheel need to cover that distance.
        Parameters:
        radius - radius of wheel
        width - track of robot
        angle - angle desired to turn the robot by
        Returns:
        the angle the robot needs to turn each wheel to rotate

      • resetMotors

        This method allows to reset the motors

        public void turnMotor()
        This method allows to rotate the side motors in order to lift the two frames
